reviews.review: No words can explain this awsome game! =) You just have to play it and enjoy it =). So chop chop guys! Get it and fall in love with this game! =)

Esse game é uma verdadeira obra-prima

História bem complicada de se entender, "guerras" contra vários policiais e soldados em uma cidade que voa, um ótimo vilão e uma parceira útil pra c***lho(a NPC mais útil que ja vi até hoje em um game, é sério!).
Uns 60/70% da história é contada por fonógrafos encontrados ao longo do avanço da campanha, você ganha também power-ups chamados de vigores durante a gameplay que te permitem queimar um inimigo vivo por exemplo, ou converter uma máquina inimiga para o seu lado.
Enfim, prefiro deixar a review por aqui mesmo para não estragar a experiência dos que ainda não compraram.

Se você ainda não comprou, ja está mais do que na hora. Não da pra deixar um jogo como esse passar batido!
스토리보고 지리고 결말보고 지리고

I had a good time with bioshock infinite.  But it has its flaws, flaws that i forgot after playing the through the ending of the game that left me in awe storywise.  But now that it has settled after some days i can tell you guys about it.  First of all this game has just like the original bioshock plasmids, in this game they are called tonics.  But to be honest i never really felt the need to use most of them during the whole game.  You can just go guns blazing and on normal difficulty it is just super easy to stroll through the game.  

Another thing was the looting and vending machines wich are also pretty useless and i think the game would have been better to have just been without them and adapted to a different system that worked better with the gameplay.  I understand they needed to have these things to make the connection to bioshock but to be honest this is a completely different game.  It is a first person shooter where they try to put in these rpg elements that dont work all that well.  

But after all things done and said i did have a great time with this game, it was a bit short on the playthrough but the story did make up for all these negative points i have about it in the end.  Oh yeah and the graphics, artstyle and music were just beautiful.
Top
YES.
good

Let's make something clear before i make this review of this amazing game. It will be, forever, one of the greatest games I have ever had the honor of playing. It has earned and will keep being my favorite #1 game. I will go over the pro's and cons. Very few SPOILERS in this review as it pretains to certain characters. I have also played Both Bioshock 1 and 2 and loved those both. Now we take a step from the underwater city of rapture, to the city in the clouds, Columbia.

Pros:
 - GRAPHICS: Great bright and vibrant graphics, you don't even need recommended specs to make the game look as good as it is. Even in area's that are darkened, it is the right mix. 
- GAMEPLAY: Fast and intense while a bit of strategy is optional. *Spoiler point* What i mean by optional is activating and using Elizabeth's ability to rip open traps and rip holes in the very fabric of time and space. It is of course an FPS game, and honestly you don't need to aim. That may sound like a bad thing, but it is how some people play, (Personally i charge with a shotgun and survive just like how the Vanguard in Mass Effect operates). Playstyles differ, from either being ranged and not really getting close to enemies, or have a quick and intense take down. Only one immersion breaker is how you get revived and keep on fighting. I'll let you play the game to see how it works since if I say it's spoilers :P.
- CHARACTERS: VERY VERY memorable. I love all of them and each one plays a big part of the story. If anything, my most memorable and favorite female character of all time comes from this game. Elizabeth (MASSIVE SPOILER HERE) otherwise known as Anna DeWitt, is an amazing character that displays all kinds of personailites, from being a sheltered, sometimes naiive girl,  sometimes a rebel trying to find her paradise of Paris, to a strong hardened woman by the end of the game. her voice actor is great and the way she survives and unravels the truth of why she was cooped up in a tower since her being a child, makes the story even better, by invoking feelings not only for Booker, but greatly for Elizabeth because of what she goes through. The main guy we play Mr. Booker DeWitt, (Voiced by Troy Baker, the voice of Snow from Final Fantasy 13, 13-2, and Lightning Returns) is a man wrapped in Mystery from the beginning from being dropped off to an abandoned Lighthouse, to a character we all come to feel a connection to. I cannot go very deep into the Main Villian, not because i can't explain him, it's because even if I do it'll give away too much of the story that i already talked about, so play for yourself and be immersed. The side characters, if you listen close to the story, play a massive role while you venture into the world of Columbia. 
- ATMOSPHERE AND SETTING: It is 1912, and you can expect the clothing and way people act, to be very much like the people in that time period. Even the buildings and scenery are like that (Disregarding that they are in the clouds mind you). The atmosphere has a constant shift within the game, the warm and fuzzy comfort in the beginning begin to die out as you progress into chaos and fire. It was a smart way to keep the player involved in the game. 

Cons: This list is very short because I could hardly find any.
- ENEMIES: This one is kind of a double edged blade. Sometimes the enemies are way too easy and certain unique enemies are a laugh too. But then again, some other enemies are wayyy too difficult to even beat at one on one. But they enemies are creative and inspired and the way you meet them fit perfectly of where you are in the story. 
- GLITCHES: Not very many, but very costly and annoying ones. I used a power to charge enemies quickly, my game FPS dropped hard, then i was teleported into limbo. Annoying, but luckily for save features it's not that bad, but still, I had to put something here. 
- WEAPONS: I have to admit some of the Tier 2 weapons, are really weak or useless to their original or tier 1 versions. Like the shotgun and assault rifle, i prefer their original forms over their upgraded Tier 2 forms. Luckily you can swap them out at any time provided you find them. 

Final Decision: After playing the game even after the first playthrough, i teared up a bit because of the story ends and the realization of things. This kind of emotional reaction is very rare in me, so you know it's great. 
RATING: 10/10 
I shit you not. Play the game and enjoy. 

-Signed, neverknowing.
IS a great game, the plat is beautiful along with its looks! very good at making u wanna keep playing!
Simply awsome ! Amazing Story line, recomended ! :D

I really really enjoy the game a lot & I love how different it is compared to Rapture but I still get the Bioshock feel in a completely different setting. The games FPS mechanics are great, although I really wish you could carry more than just two weapons at any given time. It really forces you to find two weapons that you find to be the best and you basically keep them for the rest of the game. The Vigors are all impressive visually but not all of them are as useful, you will find yourself using the same two or three vigors time after time. All in all this game is a true masterpiece and I haven't played anything like it. The complete overhaul of the "American Patriortism" is refreshing in a chilling and mystifying way. There will be parts that will make you cringe and will make you second guess what life would be in a world alike this one. A MUST BUY! & A MUST PLAY!

GREAT GAME!! BUY IT!! Best story I've ever played (heavy mindfuck included)..
Bioshock infinite est surment le meilleur jeux d'aventure  que j'ai jouer de ma vie , l'histoire est hallucinante et on s'ennuie pas avec son style FPS. Les graphismes sont époustouflant.

Começo a jogar e me pergunto: Qualé a desse jogo? Continuo a jogar e continuo: qualé a desse jogo!? Estou na metade do jogo e continuo: Que massa! Qualé a desse jogo!? Termino o jogo e penso: Que jogo incrível! Qualé a dele!!?

Um jogo incrível. De cabo a rabo você vê como ele é super bonito, dá atenção à todos os detalhes. Te deixa na ação o tempo todo, podendo jogar com estilos de jogo diferentes: tiros e tiros, ou tiros e poderes? O enredo, na minha opinão, é o que há de melhor em ficção científica... E te deixa preso o tempo todo. Você não consegue parar até descobrir qualé a desse jogo... E quando você descobre, continua querendo descobrir mais. Mas acabou né? Fazer o quê.

Se ainda não jogou, é bom se batizar logo e começar! E cuidado pra não se apaixonar pela garota!

Its one of the best games I have ever played.

Must have.

J'avais beaucoup entendu parler de ce jeu. Je me le suis acheté... et quelle bonne surprise!!! De beaux graphismes, une bonne histoire, un bon gameplay! Il y a aussi des personnages ... Justes magistraux ( comme les lutece twins), quelques références bibliques. Bref de quoi s'amuser. Mais, par contre, tout ca est plombé par une facilité même en mode normal, 2-3 toniques tellement cheatés que tu n'utilises que ceux-là et une durée de vie très limitée... Bref, il a tout pour plaire mais les plus courts sont les meilleurs...Malheureusement...

Points positifs:
-des supers graphismes
-un gameplay super
-une super histoire
-Des personnages supers charismatiques
-Des ennemis pas si cons que ca

Points négatifs:
-Une durée de vie très limitée ( 10h de jeu pr le jeu principal)
-Trop facile
-les plasmides cheatés

Franchement, je le recommande

Gorgeous visuals and a well crafted story, as one would expect from the Bioshock franchise. Gameplay was not nearly as fun as the original Bioshock, but it had its moments and the immersive world made it worth a play-through. I felt that I was just beginning to figure out the combat as the game ended, and the "plasmids" were less user-friendly this time around.

SPOILERS AHEAD

The story could have been tighter and less convoluted. I remember the original Bioshock blowing my socks off, and this got too complicated for its own good. Sure, the ending made some sense after I gave it some thought, but by that time the multiple dimensions aspect made it difficult for me to really feel for any of the characters at the end. I felt like there could have been a heavier, more emotional ending had they kept things simple.

I have bought and played this game, for those who likes story rich game, you guys should buy this awesome game by 2k and irrational game.I recommend this game very much.

Игра одна из лучших в которые вообще играл! Прошел на одном дыхании, сюжет непредсказуемый и очень захватывающий. Диалоги персонажей так же не останутся в стороне, очень в тему, насмешки, черный юмор и т.д.
Множество различного оружия и комбинаций с магией, крутите врагами как хотите!!

И на заключение скажу: Игра стоит своей полноценной цены, а если решили брать со скидкой то еще лучше. Не пожалеете!!!

10/10
Don't buy this game. Just don't.

Roteiro impressionante, mas um gameplay mediano.

Esse terceiro episódio da saga Bioshock, assim como seus antecessores possui um excelente roteiro, capaz de fazer você continuar jogando apenas por ele. 

Não que seja um jogo ruim, pelo contrário, é um excelente game.

Gráficos impressionantes, rico em detalhes, uma realidade crível em cada elemento, e quanto mais se descobre sobre a trama mais perguntas surgem, tudo com direito a um grand finale que fará sua cabeça explodir. E ainda temos as caixas de gravaçõe espalhadas pelo cenário, que te fazem querer descobrir cada detalhe por trás das personagens apresentadas, e também da misteriosa cidade flutuante.  

A jogabilidade é flúida, diferente dos antecessores, não há sensação de suspense durante o gameplay, pelo contrário, você se sente um macho alfa, acreditando que pode fazer o que quer e ir onde bem entende.

----------------------------------------------------------------------
Como jogo é ótimo, como sequência, vacilou legal.

Digo isso, porque esse jogo deixou escorrer pelo ralo uma coisa muito interessante da série, a necessidade de se adaptar à novas armas e habilidades para sobreviver, isso enriqueceu seus antecessores e tornaram eles as lendas que são hoje, mas em Infinite você pode usar apenas uma metralhadora e um elixir de fogo e ir do começo ao fim do jogo.

Quando você menos espera já está além da metade do jogo e percebe que não utilizou os recursos de mecânica que são novidade nesse game. Ou seja, você precisa fazer um teatrinho e fingir que tal inimigo precisa ser atacado com a arma X e o outro com a habilidade Y. Coisa que nos outros Bioshocks era instintiva pois o game realmente exigia e te desafiava com esse tipo de mecânica.

E falando em mecânica, o lance de deslizar pelos trilhos é outro recurso dispensável, no começo é bem promissor, mas se torna enjoativo, pois ele só existe em partes pontuadas, não te dá a liberdade de craiar estratégias com eles a qualquer momento, mas apenas quando o jogo permite e exige de você o uso deles.

比起前兩代畫面明亮很多幾乎都在戶外，劇情有點小複雜要想....
武器系統方面比較喜歡前兩代

Amazing Game! I absolutly loved it. The story was detailed, the maps were well made, and the combat was intense. 14/10!

Bioshock Infnite: Mini Review

The Good:
1. Great atmosphere. Proves that new concepts for setting can succeed and not fail.
2. The tear mechanic allows for a intresting take on combat, allowing you to spawn in helpful items.
3. A side character that isn't  something that you don't need to constantly worry about, unlike (some) other games.
4. Different enviorments that connect well together.

The Bad: 
1. Almost half of the guns are a near copy of some others, but with noticeable differences.
2. picking locks that are not story related will have you looking around for lockpicks at times.
3. Story that is good, but can be diffcult to understand at times.
4. can be confusing, at times, where you are supposed to go. 

Verdict:
Bioshock Infinite is a great game, in my opinion, but it still has some flaws. Even with those flaws, I still found it to be a enjoyable exeprience.

Rating:
8.9/10

Eres Booker Dewit, un detective privado que te han contratado para buscar a una "princesa" teniéndote que trasladar a una ciudad de fantasía (flotante) en las nubes y donde espera que alguien la "rescate" de la "torre" más alta de una...

En fin, eres detective privado y debes buscar a una chica para traerla de vuelta.

Técnicamente ese sería el argumento del juego, sin embargo, Ken Levine ha sido muy astuto al presentar Bioshock Infinite como el que sería el sucesor real del primer Bioshock. Y ciertamente, la trama no es TAN simple como la presento, pero no te voy a explicar de que va realmente. Simplemente diré que es la mejor trama que han creado para un juego (con ciertas salvedades). De hecho, la trama es muy inmersiva y siempre quieres llegar hasta el final para tener una explicación detallada sobre por que pasan las cosas.

Bioshock Infinite como ya he dicho antes, es el sucesor real del primero Bioshock, dejando a Bioshock 2 como si fuera una expansión del primero (un simple DLC un poco soso).

Los personajes y sus repectivas historias, así como la historia de la ciudad están muy bien narrados en las distintas y diferentes escenas que te encontrarás durante el juego, sin contar los vídeos y los ya conocidos audios pregrabados que escucharás por el camino.

-----------------------------------------------------------

Apartado técnico:

Te encontrarás con mucho colorido, muchos efectos visuales, y mucho aprecio por llevar un trabajo a buen puerto. Sin duda los requisitos son superados hoy en día por cualquier máquina que haya sido montada hace al menos 2 años para poder jugar (Pc gamer), pero incluso para máquinas más livianas también hay posibilidad de jugarlo, incluso con una Intel HD 3000!! (chupate esa, eso si que es optimización).

Así que, podemos decir que el juego corre a tope en una 560 sin dificultad y de forma muy fluida.

---------------------------------------------------------
Resumen general.

Bien, no voy a meterme con todos los temas por separado (jugabilidad, gráficos, controles, etc..), en gráficos si lo he hecho por que realmente que un juego esté tan optimizado es raro verlo hoy en día. Por lo demás ofreceré un concepto general.

El juego ofrece una jugabilidad muy versatil, pero con una limitada capacidad de armamento. A diferencia de lo que teníamos en Bioshock 1, que teníamos un arsenal de armas, aquí a lo sumo tendremos 2 o 3 si contamos el gancho para railes, en tema plásmidos si tendremos más variedad. Lo que al final siempre tendrás un arma favorita y pasaras a la alternativa si te encuentras con un "malo muy malo". En si los plásmidos no son nuevos, respecto a Bioshock 1, de hecho hay muy pocos nuevos, o bien son ciertamente modificados respecto a la primera versión. Pero en general, un punto de vista renovado que te permite  respirar nuevos aires tampoco viene mal.

El movimiento del personaje es fluido y realista (hasta cierto punto, hablamos de un shooter en primera persona), pero la imagen no marea, no tiene un zoom como he visto en algunos videos de algunos juegos.
Los combates son rápidos, no son cansinos, muy fluidos 

Como he dicho anteriormente, la trama es muy inmersiva, detallada (siempre que quieras saber sobre la trama) y intrigante. El juego no es muy rejugable si no fuera por las expansiones, pero realmente merece la pena si pagas 30€ por el (y si es menos, pues mejor).

El diseño del mapeado, con zonas muy abiertas, mucho salto "al vacío" y un recorrido casi "turístico" por toda la ciudad hacen de este juego un aspecto interesante que no aburre.

La dificultad no es muy elevada, y los enemigos poseen una IA un tanto pobre, por el tema de que no hay cooperación, sin embargo no es un juego en el que te debas preocupar por ello, sino en que debas apuntar bien y rápido, combinando diferentes armas y plásmidos para poder matar al grupo de malos de turno.

No hay jefes, realmente, pero si te encontrarás con un par de combates interesantes.

Recomiendo totalmente este juego, especialmente con sus expansiones de Panteon Marino (parte 1 y 2).
Ahora, una vez jugado, tal vez tengas pocas ganas de rejugarlo.

Yee, it's the best game I've played in the last 17 years.
btw I'm 17 years old.

This game is amazing.
That's it.
Buy it.

Um jogo de tiro em primeira pessoa muito bom, com excelentes trilha sonora e gráficos. O modo 1999 e realmente desafiador (Me deixou por vezes de cabeça quente). Ainda não joguei as DLC's. Já joguei duas vezes mais ainda não consegui entender porque cargas d'água ele entrega a própria filha pra si mesmo.

Мне трудно будет выразить все эмоции в моем обзоре, потому что никакие слова не выразят всю ту гамму чувств, что я испытал при прохождении этой потрясающей серии... Серии Bioshock. Напишу как есть.
Третья часть существенно отличается от первых двух. Новый персонаж, другой мир, отдельный сюжет (если не касаться дополнений). Несколько переработанная игровая механика, что наверняка вызвало много споров у фанатов. Для меня это изменение не играло особой роли, а учитывая иной временной период относительно происшествий в предыдущих частях игры, оно вполне логично. Но что осталось неизменным, так это атмосфера игры. В третьей части [i]2K Games[/i] смогли построить новый мир, умудрившись при этом сохранить дух предшественника. И за это я им безгранично благодарен.
Насчет DLC. Здесь это вам не "хухры-мухры", а почти что отдельная полноценная игра и, что важнее, обе части дополнения связывают воедино всю трилогию, следовательно если вы фанат, то рекомендовано к прохождению. Разве что стоит упомянуть, что "BI:BaS - E1" маленькая предыстория к "BI:BaS - E2". Просто меня смутило, что оба дополнения равны по цене при столь очевидной между ними разнице. Но как бы там ни было, опираясь на цену "Bioshock Infinite", дополнения, в целом, стоят своей цены.
Моя оценка =>
[b]10 из 10[/b]

P.S. Есть хорошая любительская русская локализация ([url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=343608013]вот здесь[/url]). Самое интересное, что Элизабет озвучивала девушка, по образу которой и сделали главную героиню!

Burial at sea returns to Rapture and departs from the normal gameplay and adds a whole new stealth mechanic which makes the gameplay so much better and the end of it left me with my mouth hanging open. I was absolutley astounded. I highly reccomend this game and Burial at Sea to everone.

While I wasn't a fan of the first two Bioshocks and their stories, this game hit the nail on the head.  Keeps you guessing til' the very end.  I've never been a fan of the gameplay of the series, but it's more finely tuned this time around.  Similar, but better.  Overall a great game!

Simplemente un grandioso juego de principio a fin, en el cual nos encontramos con una perfecta excusa para ir a una ciudad en los cielos como podria ser una deuda pendiente.

Su historia incluyendo el primer "Bioshock" y los DLC's de este es magnifica y una delicia ademas de ser una obra maestra total, tanto de manera argumental como en los distintos apartados como podrian ser los graficos y la banda sonora, lo unico malo de esto es que con los DLC's de este se termina la historia lo cual nos cierra el paso a una secuela, pero por el resto no le puedo encontrar defecto alguno, cosa que no me sucede con otros grandes titulos, es mi saga favorita, simplemente comprenlo.

10/10
Give us the girl and wipe away the debt!

I have a lot to say about this game so I will just make the positives and the negatives ones although the negative ones don't affect much it's a good game.
Positives:
+Best art design I've seen in a game.
+Good story.
+Really good atmosphere that immerses you completely.
 Negatives:
-Combat is solid but boring, doesn't have a satisfying feel to it, and I don't know why they put only 2 weapons for use although the lack of difficulty and having all vigors kinda makes sense but there wasn't really one that I enjoyed the most like in bioshock 1/2 the shotgun and speargun they were just all meh.
-Difficulty is just dumbly easy, I didn't tried 1999 difficulty but from what I've played on hard the difficulty it was just a case of having your resources or not and dying resulting in loosing money , mana and hp since you don't have manual saves or either quicksaves.
Conclusion:
 What I see from all bioshocks is that the combat starts to be the same old thing and they should improve that or innovate since what made this game was the atmosphere, the story, the atmosphere feeling like you were into an experience to be felt by someone that put a lot of effort into. It's an work of art definitely and will be a different experience from person to person but it could be better with an improved combat system.
Also I've catch some coins from Elizabeth from 100 meters so that was a record to me.

Внимание, отзыв содержит спойлеры.

На мой взгляд, Bioshock Infinite (далее – BI) – это символ торжества формы над содержанием. Отставив первое впечатление (в общем, положительно-нейтральное), я думаю, что эта игра не заслуживает рекомендации, прежде всего, из-за проблем в сюжетной части.

Несмотря на очень претенциозное начало игры, где ставятся вопросы расизма, религиозного фанатизма, классовой борьбы (и многие другие), за все время прохождения я так и не увидел, как именно эти проблемы раскрываются разработчиками. На самом деле, указанные темы (а также, в сущности, вся Колумбия и 99% ее жителей) не оказывают ни малейшего влияния на сюжет игры.

Приведу пример: в середине игры мы тратим около 2 часов на поиски оружия только для того, чтобы обнаружить, что в параллельной вселенной наше задание уже было выполнено и происходит революция, в которой наш персонаж значительным образом поучаствовал. Вместо презентации мотивов, причин и действий Букера, а также ответов на вопросы, каким образом революция сумела так быстро принять большие масштабы в этой реальности, разработчики предлагают несколько голосовых записей и новую цель – вернуться к дирижаблю. Игрок должен принять все происходящее как данность и двигаться дальше, не задавая вопросов (а-ля Would you kindly...). Серьезно? 

Далее: в отличие от Bioshock и Bioshock 2, в BI не раскрываются детали характера второстепенных персонажей, тут нет своего Сандера Коэна или Гилберта Александра, почти нет голосовых дневников простых жителей, что также не способствует атмосферности игры. Данный недостаток можно было бы списать на то, что центральными для сюжета являются Букер и Элизабет, но почему в Bioshock 2 (другие разработчики-примеч.) смогли создать как запоминающуюся пару основных персонажей, так и харизматичных NPC второго плана?

Пожалуй, важно упомянуть о том, что в игре нет совершенно никакого объяснения, каким образом жители Колумбии дышат, находясь на столь значительной высоте или, например, почему никто, кроме ГГ и 2 типов врагов не пользуется местными аналогами плазмидов, что мешало Комстоку использовать поцелуй дьявола на Букере и т.п.

Все это достаточно небольшие детали, но, накапливаясь, они разрушают целостность восприятия сюжета. Bioshock и Bioshock 2 рассказывали небольшие, но цельные и глубокие истории, посвященные одному-двум вопросам. В BI авторы попытались объять очень большой круг проблем, но в итоге получилось внятно рассказать только об одной из них в течение последних 10 минут игры. 

Стоит ли ради 10 минут цельного рассказа (о совершении грехов и искуплении отдельно взятого человека) посвящать около 10 часов красивой по форме, но бессвязной содержательно игре?
IGN would rate this 25/10! Buy it, buy it, buy it!

Short version:

Do I recommend Bioshock Infinite?
- Yes! But get Burial at sea 1 & 2!




Loooong version:

After hearing the praise the game received I felt I had to try it out. At the same time also I felt a tiny bit worried because I thought the first Bioshock game was overhyped. Whatever the case, Infinite remained one of the must-haves on my wishlist.

I bought it on sale and grabbed the season pass at the same time. And after playing through it all I would recommend that everybody interested in the game gets the whole package since the story isn't done after the main game. Sadly, the Bioshock triple pack never seems to include any DLC. Note that you only need Burial at Sea 1 and 2, as clash in the clouds is extra challenges only. But the season pass is probably the cheapest way to aquire these.

Bioshock infinite:
At first sight it's a beautiful game, so crank up the visual effects as high as you possibly can get them. The game comes with a benchmarking tool that's very handy when trying to determine the highest available settings on your PC. I started with the second highest benchmarking settings but had to tune them down a bit once I was in game to get comfortable frame rates. This was using a 7790 with 1GB.

The water and lighting effects is were the game shines giving you some stunning views on new areas as you enter them.  You should, however, avoid looking too close on the details because upon inspection there are some that are absolutely horrendus. Fruit baskets seems to have a lid with fruits painted on them but If you run by them you wont notice.
The game world is generally very linear, but there are almost always extra rooms and hidden secrets around if you look hard enough. They have managed to create a world that feels much bigger and more open than it actually is.

The story is great and that togehter with the overall stunning visuals is the reason I play the game. Too bad combat often feels like interruptions, a task to push through to get to the next story element. Enemies felt the same and boss fights were generally tedious. Too few of the enemies had some actual interesting backstory, off the top of my head I can think of only one.
Weapons felt very similar and upgrading them often felt like a waste since you don't know how much you will run into that same kind of weapon further in the game. You are also limited to two weapons so if you run out of ammo for the one you upgraded you just have to do without it until you find some more. I also never felt that upgrading a weapon provided any immediate improvement.
I considered uping the difficulty, but the combat already felt like a grind so I was afraid higher difficulty would only worsen that problem.

Despite the issues I have with the game I really like Bioshock Infinite. It's a story heavy game, and the story is definitely the best part of it. I felt for the characters, especially in the ending. I have seldom had a game remaining in my mind as Infinite did after I finnished it.

Clash in the clouds:
I won't really comment on this as I have played very little of it. It's more Bioshock Infinite combat. You fight waves of enemies on a couple of different maps.

Burial at sea 1:
You return to rapture and for a while you get to see some of it while it's actually intact. The weapon system is remade to be more like the original Bioshock, allowing you to carry every weapon at once but very little ammo for each. My battles vere quite intense in the beginning as I at first did not realise that I had more than two weapons :p
The change of setting is nice, replacing the open skies for the claustrofobic underwater buildings.
This epidode is quite short, but I don't really mind that. It's not really able to stand on it's own, it's the bridge between Infinite and Burial at sea 2.

Burial at sea 2:
Here you play as Elizabeth. The game also changes style and becomes stealth oriented. If Burial at sea 1 failed to really impress then Burial at sea 2 really makes up for it. You get a lot of backstory and the episode ties all the games together pretty nicely. I generally like stealth games so this was up my alley.
The atmosphere is superb, and as Elizabeth you get new weapons and gadgets to aid you. The change to stealth also fixes the problem I had with combat in the previous games.

Overall the game and the dlc's are quite easy on normal mode. I don't have a problem with that as I'm in it for the story more so than the challenge. As I said, uping the difficulty might only make the game feel like more of a grind.

I highly recommend the game to anyone who liked the original Bioshock. The fps action elements might feel dissapointing but if you enjoy the story then that flaw is easily forgiven. Anyone enjoying Bioshock infinite really must play Burial at sea 2. And anyone who intends to play urial at sea 2 really needs to play Burial at sea 1. So get both of them/the season pass.
A fantastic story that forced me to keep playing, great physics & and fps gameplay. Also awesome graphics/scenery.

And some surprising audio treats as well, from voice to effects to some of the best musical moments in gaming.

This is an absolute jaw-dropper, and a must-play.

사람이 태어나서 어느 시기만을 산다는 것은 특별한 일이다. 어느 때를 살아가든 다른 시대의 사람과 비교되는 독특한 경험을 하고, 생각을 하고, 각자만의 즐거움을 누리는 것은 나름의 축복이다. 나는 처음 'Potal'을 하면서 내가 이 시대에 태어나지 않았다면 절대로 누릴 수 없는 경험을 했다고 생각했다. 거창하게 말한다면 아주 영광이었다.

현재보다 과거인, 도대체 어떤 시대에서 내가 바쇽인피를 하는 혜택을 누릴 수 있었을까? 나는 균열도 못 여는데... 운이 좋은 인생이다.

kaufen or die

Буду очень много ругать и возможны спойлеры. Потому что ругать есть за что. А именно за геймплей и сюжет, что есть спойлеры.

Итак, дошли у меня руки до всей трилогии с дополнениями (кроме минервы, но не суть, 2 часть и сама по себе великолепна). Так как я за 4 дня прошел все 3 части то сравнить могу со свежими по ним воспоминаниями, и в отличие от других игроков инфинити не вызывает вообще никакого восторга.

Итак - это биошок но никакого "Восторга". Теперь мы отправляемся наводить шухер на "рай земной" возведённый людьми в небесах. Тоесть не будет той гнетущей атмосферы и мутантов за которые мне понравились первые 2 части.
Дополнения я рассмотрю в соответствующих темах.
Поначалу да, смотрится красиво, но когда понимаешь что никакого манёвра у тебя нет вообще, а всё что ты можешь так это тупо идти по сюжету (который не блещет оригинальностью от слова совсем, могу его сравнить только с довольно отстойным фильмом 14 года про путешествия во времени).
Далее - зачем было менять систему техномагии? мало того что поменялись названия - изменили и механику. Огненный удар стал совсем неузабельным в отличии от аналога из первых частей.
Ладно, добрались мы до цели - так появились некие "разрывы", которые девченка подгоняла в угоду себе и ГГ. Пока они были мелкими - ещё было понятно, но когда она начала ворочать целыми измерениями - я вообще выпал в осадок. Причём новое измеренее ещё более заворочено чем предыдущее. И так далее.
Видимо у разработчиков полностью кончились идеи раз они из приличного биошока решили сделать полную психоделику дурдома.
Больше всего меня в тупик поставила концовка - почему решили убить комстока до его "рождения"? Что он мог бы сделать сам по себе, без помощи пары сумашедших эйнштейнов? почему они не решили прихлопнуть их дабы подобные разработки не появились в принципе?
Далее - момент с сожжением нью-йорка - я конечно понимаю что боевые цеппелины это круто и все дела, но блин в то время которое было обозначено в нападении - уже была нормальная авиация и ПВО. Далее- как они вообще предполагали спрятать город в небе на высоте, где человеку достаточно кислорода чтобы дышать? Чтобы самолёты разведки их не обнаружили.
Про квантовые антигравитационные двигатели я вообще молчу. Если достаточно просто двигателя, то зачем нужен весь цеппелин представляющий из себя здоровенную мишень?
Вообще сложилось впечатление что когда создавали игру логика отдыхала где то в сторонке.
Особенно CG ролик после финальных титров - единственная мысль "налегать надо меньше", и это относится не только к ГГ.

Ахуенная игра!!!! На пиратке помню проходил - но увы по техническим обстоятельствам до конца не прошел!!! Мне игра жутко понравилась!! Гораздо лучше первых двух частей. Геймплей не представляет ничего особенного - просто пострелушки как во всех шутанах - но главное - это не геймпей - это сюжет - и он чертовски хорош! довольно редко в играхх подобного жанра встречается афигенный сюжет!  Еще мне понравилось это визуальная составляющая - тоесть графика - она конечно не супер пупер как в каком нибудь кризисе - а скажем слегка мультяшная - и игра просто красивая!!!
Очень понравился второстепенный персонаж который постоянно будет ходить за букером,  прикольная девчушка - Элизабэт, и в отличии от других игр где мы ходим с напарником - она не мешается и не дохнет постоянно - скорее она нас сама спасает иногда (точнее вегда и везде где куча вражины ) - бывает когда мало здоровья - может подкинуть аптечку - а если патроны на нуле - так же подкидывет патрончиков! Имеено такими должны быть напарники в играх - которые не мешаются и не дохнут все время - но опять же - это наверное чисто из за того, чем ,ну или кем является Элизабет!!!! 
Еще в игре очень понравился саундтрек - просто шедевральный!

Bioshock Infinite portrays a beautiful and broken city in the sky called Columbia.
Everything from the art to the amazing design of the steampunk palaces is tremendous. 
At an early moment you realise this city is ownering racisim with white people living easy lives in the 'above life' and black people living down in the 'lower' and darker areas of Columbia. If you have played the original bioshocks, the leader of Columbia 'Father Comstock' appears to be like Andrew Ryan from the Rapture.
Bioshock Infinite is a first-person shooter, but you aren't just armed with guns from WW1 and 2, you are armed with Vigors, like the original Bioshocks Plasmids. You can zapp people with volts of electricity or charge at them with quick speed.

Bioshock Infinite isn't afraid to magnify the way religous and racial extremisim can change our lives.
This game has extreme replay ability because of hidden iconic features and it will move your understanding.
And the ending- Is amazing 8.8/10
i love it

I would recommend this game to you, your friend, your friend's friend, your mom, and that creepy guy in the dumpster down the street. Buy this game.
